product.title: Taaffes Bar
product.description: Taaffes Bar
product.webcontent: <p> Taaffes is located in the center of the village, it is incorporated into a 16Th century castle and retains all the history with a ‘vibrant’ young atmosphere. The bar is open daily, there is a new Disco Bar upstairs with guest DJ’s open at the weekends. Private Barbe-ques or parties can be booked in advance, there is also a large beer garden at the side. There is a selection of music all weekend including Sunday afternoon. This is a lively spot at the weekend and popular with Hen’s and Stags.</p>

product.title: Carlingford Arms
product.description: Carlingford Arms
product.webcontent: <p> A warm welcome to the Carlingford Arms, a long established bar and restaurant situated in the picturesque village of carlingford. Wide ranging menus are available. Including freshly caught seafood, prime cuts of beef from the Cooley Mountains and not to forget our famous SEAFOOD CHOWDER. The selection of food also includes full child’s menu and vegetarian alternatives and our homemade desserts will make your mouth water. Our wine list is constantly being updated with new and exiting flavours to complement the menu. The restaurant enjoys full bar facilities. Children are warmly welcomed and on site facilities include baby changing room and high chairs, wheelchair access and disabled toilets are also available.</p>

product.title: Ballymascanlon Hotel
product.address: Carlingford Rd R173 Dundalk Co. Louth
product.description: Ballymascanlon Hotel
product.webcontent: <p> Ballymascanlon House is a Fáilte Ireland, AA, RAC 4**** country house hotel just 45 mins by motorway from Dublin & Belfast. Just 8 miles from medieval Carlingford, it is set on 130 acres of parkland with its own Ruddy & Craddock designed 18 hole golf course. The beautifully appointed bedroom accommodation, award-winning Restaurant and Terrace Bar are complemented by modern leisure facilities including 20m deck level pool, sauna, Jacuzzi, steam room, outdoor Canadian hot tub, gym and tennis courts. The perfect short break destination. New Function/Conference Centre now open.</p>

product.title: BoltonEugene Insulaton Ltd
product.description: BoltonEugene Insulaton Ltd
product.webcontent: <p> Eugene Bolton Insulation company is based just outside Dundalk in Greenore, Co. Louth. We specialise in the installation of cavity wall insulation (blown Polystyrene bonded bead). We are accepted by the Irish Agrément Board to install cavity wall insulation – Registration No. IAB/0191/109.  By installing cavity wall insulation you the customer can save hundreds of euro a year, furthermore you are enhancing both the comfort levels and energy efficiency of your home.</p>

product.title: Brassill Don
product.description: Brassill Don
product.webcontent: <p> <font face="Arial" size="-1"><span class="cushycms">We have 6 old stone cottages which comprise 4 one bedroom cottages, 1 two bedroom cottage and 1 three bedroom cottage. They are secluded accommodation set adjacent to Greenore Golf Links, Medieval Carlingford, Slieve Foye Forest and Tain Way mountain walks. Sheeling hill beach and Whitestown shore just 5km away.Take the R175 from Dundalk for 21kms in the direction of Carlingford. The cottages are located on the right just before the turn for Carlingford.</span></font></p>

product.webcontent: <p> Dining here reflects the full scope of eating out, 14 reputable places to dine in. Enjoy the culinary delights of locally sourced ingredients, skillfully cooked and served in attractive surroundings.</p>

product.title: The Oyster Catcher
product.description: The Oyster Catcher
product.webcontent: <p> The Oystercatcher Lodge and Bistro has seven rooms. They are best described as mini-suites and are spacious and elegant with vaulted ceilings, wooden floors and all modern facilities. Many have excellent mountain views.  The menu in the Bistro reflects the essence of Carlingford ~ Mountain and Sea. We are lucky to have exquisite organic mountain lamb, tender Cooley beef, a wonderful selection of the freshest fish to chose from and an excellent wine list.</p>

product.title: Baytree Restaurant
product.description: Baytree Restaurant
product.webcontent: <p> We are a chef-owned family business and our passion is reflected in the cooking, which offers very good value, high quality food. In our restaurant we serve local crab, scallops, mussels & lobster when available, hand picked cockles and samphire, all for good value prices and we don't skimp on the portions. But you can also get your traditional steak and we are open for Sunday lunch. All our fish and meat is 100% locally sourced and we are proud to offer you the best Carlingford produce.</p>

product.title: CANAL COURT HOTEL
product.address: 29-32 Merchants Quay, Newry, Co Down, BT35 8HF
product.description: Award-winning, city centre Canal Court Hotel offers ensuite bedrooms with satellite tv, hospitality trays, direct dial phone and ironing facilities. Health and leisure facilities to include gym, swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi and steam room. Food served daily from 7am to 9.30 pm. Conference facilities for 400 - superb suites available for weddings and private functions. The Canal Court Hotel is the perfect venue for all occasions and offers fantastic special breaks all year.

product.title: The Empress Hotel
product.address: The Empress Hotel, Central Promenade, Douglas, Isle of Man, IM2 4RA
product.description: A warm welcome from us all at the Empress Hotel on the Isle of Man. The hotel commands a prime position on the Victorian promenade overlooking Douglas Bay and is just a short walk from the town centre. Built at the end of the last century, the hotel has been extensively upgraded and proudly maintains its status as one of the best hotels on the island.
product.webcontent: <p> A warm welcome from us all at the Empress Hotel on the Isle of Man. The hotel commands a prime position on the Victorian promenade overlooking Douglas Bay and is just a short walk from the town centre. Built at the end of the last century, the hotel has been extensively upgraded and proudly maintains its status as one of the best hotels on the island.</p>

product.title: Downpatrick Tourist Information Centre
product.address: The Saint Patrick Centre, 53a Market Street Downpatrick, BT30 6LZ
product.description: We can give you a wide range of information on the local area and free tourism literature covering the Down District and the whole of Northern Ireland. You can comfortably browse our literature in our seating area for customers

product.address: Magees Bistro, Tholsel Street, Carlingford, Co. Louth
product.description: Fine simple cooking with a wide range of local seafood and our special selection displayed on our blackboard all from around the bay along with local beef and poultry from the local farms.

product.description: Food For Thought is an award winning Delicatessen and Food Hall in the heart of Medieval Carlingford, Co Louth. There are over 2,000 speciality food items from Ireland and worldwide, so you have a vast range of foods to choose from.

product.title: Ghan House
product.description: Conveniently located just an hour from Dublin or Belfast airports, the Carroll familys 18th century house is attractively situated in its own grounds on the edge of Carlingford village, with romantic views across the lough to the Mountains of Mourne.

product.description: On entering Pearl Beauty immediately you are enveloped in an air of serenity. This intimate beauty salon is appropriately named, as whats inside is precious.

product.description: We offer the best of Land and Sea, with steaks to make your mouth water, sea food to make your taste buds tingle.

product.description: Wood Quay provides unique self-catering accommodation. Large reception rooms, warm character and local attractions make it an ideal venue for weekends, family parties, conferences, meetings, etc.

product.title: Rampark Farmhouse
product.description: Authentic old world thatched two storey house (built 1750) overlooking the sea at rear and with views of the Cooley mountains to the front.

product.title: Restawyle
product.description: Restawyle is located in the historic village of Carlingford where buildings such as King Johns Castle create a wonderful ambiance.

product.title: Fitzpatricks Restaurant
product.description: Finest dining in the north east, full bar and Al a Carte menu, catering to everyones needs.

product.title: The Byre Studios
product.description: Local artist who captures on canvas the beauty of The Cooley Peninsula, therefore never short of inspiration.

product.title: Ravensdale Lodge, Equestrian & Trekking Centre
product.description: Ravensdale Lodge Equestrian,Trekking and Event Centre is Irelands premier Equestrian facility.

product.title: Greenore Golf Club
product.description: This 18 hole championship links course offers a challenge to every type of golfer. Facilities include a practice range, a chipping and putting green.

product.title: Ballymacscanlon Golf Course
product.description: Catering for all your needs - with our Golf course, leisure breaks and corporate breaks, with use of a leisure centre

product.title: Loughs Agency
product.description: The Loughs waters around Foyle and Carlingford offer the angler some superb fishing and are becoming very popular destinations for the tourist angler.

product.title: Belmont Self Catering
product.description: This 200 year old farmhouse recently refurbished, is located in a rural area close to the medieval town of Carlingford. This farmhouse is now a holiday home.

product.title: Bird's Lane Apartments
product.address: 18 Euston Street, Greenore, Carlingford, Co. Louth
product.description: Greenore is one of the jewels in the crown of Cooley Peninsula situated on the shores of Carlingford Lough.

product.title: The Courtyard Carlingford
product.description: The courtyard is a newly developed self catering accomodation village, constructed from the remains of a family run 18th century farm yard.

product.title: Heavenly Cakes
product.description: Bespoke Wedding Cakes, Cupcakes, Birthday Cakes, Party Cakes, for all occasions, just call, I can make your sweet dreams come true.

product.title: Cornamucklagh House
product.description: Cornamucklagh House (perviously known as Davey's) is a local pub & restaurant situated on the main road from Newry to Omeath.

product.title: Kilkeel Tourist Centre
product.address: Rooney Road, Kilkeel, Newry, Co Down, BT34 4AG
product.description: The Nautilus Centre overlooks Kilkeel's busy and picturesque fishing port and houses the Mourne Maritime Visitor Centre, Kilkeel Tourist Information Centre and Mourne Seafood Cookery School.

product.title: Newcastle Tourist Information Office
product.description: The Tourist Information Centre is committed to providing quality services which are valued by people who live in and visit the area.

product.title: Carlingford Tourist Office
product.description: General tourism information, local literature, maps, guides and souvineers. Accommodation bookings and guided tours of medieval Carlingford.

product.title: Dundalk Tourist Office
product.description: Accommodation booking service. Itinerary and route planning. Local and national information. Map sales. What's on, in the area and nationally.

product.title: Walk Northern Ireland

product.description: The beauty and variety of the Northern Ireland landscape, the compact distances and ever- changing vistas make this a wonderful place to explore on foot.

product.title: Mourne Archery Centre
product.address: 35 Carnacavill Road, Maghera, County Down, BT31 9HD

product.title: Al Burj
product.description: Indian and Turkish split level restaurant, cater for all your needs.

product.title: Al Burj
product.description: Indian and Turkish split level restaurant, cater for all your needs.

product.title: The Mourne Lodge

product.description: Ballymote House is a listed Georgian house built around 1730 which has been beautifully restored, with antique furniture throughout, roaring fire and delicious home cooked food.

product.title: Tyrella House

product.title: The Swan Lodge B&B

product.title: The Cottage Schoolhouse

article.title: Carlingford voted the top town in Ireland - beats Dublin at the top spot to live
